sentences.original: kayâs mitonih kisêyiniw êwakôw okimâw.
sentences.text: kayâs mitoni kisêyiniw êwako okimâw
sentences.english: In the time of the men of long ago he was chief.

sentences.original: ôma nakîwacîhk ôtah wîkiwak.
sentences.text: ôma nakîwacîhk ôta wîkiwak
sentences.english: Here at  Sweet-Grass they dwelt.

sentences.original: kîtahtawê kîkisêpâ otnêw misatimwah; oyahpitêw, êh-têhtapit; sipwêhtêw, êh-papâmohtêt.
sentences.text: kîtahtawê kîkisêpâ otinêw misatimwa oyahpitêw ê-têhtapit sipwêhtêw ê-papâmohtêt
sentences.english: One morning, he took a horse; he saddled it  and mounted; he set out to roam.

sentences.original: mêkwâ êh-pimohtêt, ipatinâw wâpahtam, êh-âmaciwêyit ayîsiyiniwah, nâpêwah.
sentences.text: mêkwâ ê-pimohtêt ispatinâw wâpahtam ê-âmaciwêyit ayîsiyiniwa nâpêwa
sentences.english: As he went along he saw someone climbing a hill, a man. He observed him, watching through a spy-glass,  this man who was looking for people.

sentences.original: kiskêyimêw ayâhciyiniwah.
sentences.text: kiskêyimêw ayahciyiniwa
sentences.english: He knew him for a Blackfoot.
sentences.footnote: LB on {ayâhciyiniwah}:  In earlier texts I have noted the second vowel of this word as long;  later I heard it as predominantly short.

sentences.original: êkwah opâskisikan pîhtâsôw; môskîstawêw êh-pimisiniyit.
sentences.text: êkwa opâskisikan pîhtâsôw môskîstawêw ê-pimisiniyit
sentences.english: He loaded his gun and attacked him as he lay on the ground.

sentences.original: êkwah êh-kîh-kiskêyihtahk aw ayâhciyiniw, nêhiyawah ê-môskîstâkot, tapasîw;
sentences.text: êkwa ê-kî-kiskêyihtahk awa ayahciyiniw nêhiyawa ê-môskîstâkot tapasîw
sentences.english: When the Blackfoot perceived that a Cree was attacking him, he fled;

sentences.original: ê-sakâyik kotêskamôw.
sentences.text: ê-sakâyik kotêskâmôw
sentences.english: he hid in the bushes.

sentences.original: êkosi pâskiswêw nêhiyaw.
sentences.text: êkosi pâskiswêw nêhiyaw
sentences.english: The Cree tried to shoot him,

sentences.original: namoya matwêwiw pâskisikan.
sentences.text: namôya matwêwêw pâskisikan
sentences.english: but the gun did not go off.

sentences.original: êkotah ê-sêskâmot, êkotaw ohci mâtâwisiwak nîsosâp iyâhciyiniwak.
sentences.text: êkota ê-sêskâmot êkota ohci matâwisiwak nîsosâp ayahciyiniwak
sentences.english: From the place where he had fled into the woods, twelve Blackfoot came out upon the trail.

sentences.original: êkwah nêhiyaw êh-pêyakot môskîstawêw, ê-wîh-nôtinât, a-wîh-pâskiswât.
sentences.text: êkwa nêhiyaw ê-pêyakot môskîstawêw ê-wî-nôtinât ê-wî-pâskiswât
sentences.english: The lone Cree attacked them, wanting to do battle and shoot them.

sentences.original: tapasîwak ôki iyâhciyiniwak, êh-pêyakowit êh-kostâcik, êh-pâh-pâskisokocik.
sentences.text: tapasîwak ôki ayahciyiniwak ê-pêyakoyit ê-kostâcik ê-pâh-pâskisokocik
sentences.english: The Blackfoot  fled, fearing the one Cree who was shooting at them.

sentences.original: kotak sakâw êkotah mînah sêskâmôwak.
sentences.text: kotak sakâw êkota mîna sêskâmôwak
sentences.english: They fled into another wood.

sentences.original: âsay mînah mâtâwisiwak, êh-pimipahtâcik.
sentences.text: âsay mîna matâwisiwak ê-pimipahtâcik
sentences.english: Again they came forth in their course.

sentences.original: êkwah awa nêhiyaw êh-têhtapit, êkotê mîkiwâhpah, miton ê-mihcêticik nêhiyawak, êkotê êh-itisahwât.
sentences.text: êkwa awa nêhiyaw ê-têhtapit êkotê mîkiwâhpa mitoni ê-mihcêticik nêhiyawak êkotê ê-itisahwât
sentences.english: But the Cree on his horse was driving them to where the Cree were many in their tents.

sentences.original: iyâhciyiniw êkotê nika-pimâtisin, êh-itêyihtahk, namoya kiskêyihtam ayîsiyiniwah nêhiyawah ê-mihcêtiyit êkotah k-êtohtêcik.
sentences.text: ayahciyiniw ê-itêyihtahk namôya kiskêyihtam ayîsiyiniwa nêhiyawa ê-mihcêtiyit êkota kâ-itohtêcik
sentences.english: The Blackfoot meanwhile, thinking, “In this direction  I shall escape,” did not know that there were many people, many Cree in the place to which they were going.

sentences.original: iyikohk êh-wâpamâcik nêhiyawah, êkoyikohk wayoniwak, êh-kîh-wâpamâcik mihcêt nêhiyawah.
sentences.text: iyikohk ê-wâpamâcik nêhiyawa êkoyikohk wâyonîwak ê-kî-wâpamâcik mihcêt nêhiyawa
sentences.english: When they saw the Cree, they turned, at the sight of the many Cree.

sentences.original: êkwah pêyak awah nîsosâp iyâhciyiniwah êh-nawaswâtât, ê-sakâyik êyakô môskîstamwak sîpîsis.
sentences.text: êkwa pêyak awa nîsosâp ayahciyiniwa ê-nawaswâtât ê-sakâyik êwako môskîstamwak sîpîsis
sentences.english: Then, as the one was pursuing the twelve Blackfoot, in a wooded place they made for a creek.

sentences.original: êkotah pahkopêwak, êh-âsôwahahkik.
sentences.text: êkota pahkopêwak ê-âsôwahahkik
sentences.english: They went into the water to cross.

sentences.original: êkotah nipîhk kôkîw pêyak ayâhciyiniw, êh-kâsôt, namoya nika-wâpamik nêhiyaw, êh-itêyihtahk.
sentences.text: êkota nipîhk kôkîw pêyak ayahciyiniw ê-kâsot ê-itêyihtahk
sentences.english: There one of the Blackfoot ducked under water to hide, thinking, “The Cree will not see me.”

sentences.original: kotakak ôkih tapasîwak pêyakosâp; kotak sakâw êkotê sêskisiwak.
sentences.text: kotakak ôki tapasîwak pêyakosâp kotak sakâw êkotê sêskisiwak
sentences.english: The other eleven fled; they went into another wood.

sentences.original: êkotê êkwah nêhiyawak wîhkwêskawêwak, tâpiskôc wâtihkân êh-osîhtâcik iyâhciyiniwak, êh-nôtinikêcik.
sentences.text: êkotê êkwa nêhiyawak wîhkwêskawêwak tâpiskôc wâtihkân ê-osîhtâcik ayahciyiniwak ê-nôtinikêcik
sentences.english: There the Cree surrounded them, the Blackfoot making a kind of trench as they fought.

sentences.original: êkwah ôki nêhiyawak kisiwâk êh-itohtêcik itah êh-ayâyit iyâhciyiniwah, êkwah êwako kâ-papâ-nawaswâtât, êwako nîkânohtêw, tâpiskôc ayah simâkanis-okimâw,
sentences.text: êkwa ôki nêhiyawak kisiwâk ê-itohtêcik ita ê-ayâyit ayahciyiniwa êkwa êwako kâ-papâ-nawaswâtât êwako nîkânohtêw tâpiskôc aya simâkanisikimâw
sentences.english: When the Cree went near to where the Blackfoot were, then he who had pursued them, he went in the lead, like an officer,

sentences.original: êkwah ôkih ayâhciyiniwak kisiwâk êh-wâpamâcik nêhiyawah êkwah omah wâtihkân omah k-âyâcik.
sentences.text: êkwa ôki ayahciyiniwak kisiwâk ê-wâpamâcik nêhiyawa êkwa ôma wâtihkân ôma kâ-ayâcik
sentences.english: and the Blackfoot saw the Cree come near the trench where they were.

sentences.original: êkwah ninisô nêhiyawak êkotah nîpawiwak wâtihkânihk cîkih.
sentences.text: êkwa ninisô nêhiyawak êkota nîpawiwak wâtihkânihk cîki
sentences.english: And the Cree stood there close to the pit.
sentences.footnote: LB on {ninisô}:  Word unknown to me; probably a mishearing.

sentences.original: êkwah pêyak nêhiyaw tâpiskôc omah mistik ôtah -- êh-tâh-tahkamât môhkomân ohci ayâhciyiniwah; êyako pêyak nêhiyaw kâ-tôtahk.
sentences.text: êkwa pêyak nêhiyaw tâpiskôc ôma mistik ôta ê-tâh-tahkamât môhkomân ohci ayahciyiniwa êwako pêyak nêhiyaw kâ-tôtahk
sentences.english: Then one Cree - holding it like this stick here - with his knife began to stab the Blackfoot; one Cree did this.

sentences.original: êkosi êkwah kahkiyaw nêhiyawak pîhtokêwak wâtihkânihk, môhkomân êh-tahkonahkik, nêhiyawak ôhi ayâhciyiniwah êh-tâh-tahkamâcik môhkomân ohci.
sentences.text: êkosi êkwa kahkiyaw nêhiyawak pîhtokêwak wâtihkânihk môhkomân ê-tahkonahkik nêhiyawak ôhi ayahciyiniwa ê-tâh-tahkamâcik môhkomân ohci
sentences.english: Thereupon all the Cree began to enter the trench, knife in hand, stabbing one Blackfoot after another.

sentences.original: nipahêwak;
sentences.text: nipahêwak
sentences.english: They slew them;

sentences.original: kahkiyaw nam âwiyak pimâtisiw pêyakosâp aniki ayâhciyiniwak.
sentences.text: kahkiyaw nama awiyak pimâtisiw pêyakosâp aniki ayahciyiniwak
sentences.english: not one of those eleven Blackfoot was left alive.

sentences.original: êkosi êkwah môhkomân ohci êh-manisamawâcik, ostikwâniyiwah êh-manisamwâcik nêhiyawak.
sentences.text: êkosi êkwa môhkomân ohci ê-manisamawâcik ostikwâniyiwa ê-manisamawâcik nêhiyawak
sentences.english: Then with their knives they scalped them; the Cree cut the scalps from their heads.

sentences.original: êkosi poyôwak.
sentences.text: êkosi poyôwak
sentences.english: Then they ceased.

sentences.original: ayis mêscihêwak; êyak ohci kâ-poyocik.
sentences.text: ayis mêscihêwak êwako ohci kâ-poyocik
sentences.english: They had finished them all; that was why they ceased.

sentences.original: êkotaw ohci ana kâ-pêyakot, nistam kâ-wâpamât ôhi ayâhciyiniwah, êwak ôhci mistahi kîh-okimâwiw.
sentences.text: êkota ohci ana kâ-pêyakot nistam kâ-wâpamât ôhi ayahciyiniwa êwako ohci mistahi kî-okimâwiw
sentences.english: For this exploit he who had gone alone, and had first seen those Blackfoot, he became a great chief for this exploit.

sentences.original: êwak ôma swît-kwâs isiyihkâsôw, owîhkasko-kisêyin isiyihkâsôw.
sentences.text: êwako ôma swît-kwâs isiyîhkâsôw wîhkasko-kisêyin isiyîhkâsôw
sentences.english: His name was Sweet-Grass.

sentences.original: êwakô ê-kîh-okimâwit, kayâs kisêyiniwak.
sentences.text: êwako ê-kî-okimâwit kayâs kisêyiniwak
sentences.english: He was chief among the men of old.

sentences.original: êwakô kayâs âcimôwin.
sentences.text: êwako kayâs âcimôwin
sentences.english: This is a story of long ago.

sentences.original: êwakô otaskîhk kâ-pêhtamân oma otâcimôwin, êkotah êh-apiyân otaskihk oma kw-otinamân âcimôwin.
sentences.text: êwako otaskîhk kâ-pêhtamân ôma otâcimôwin êkota ê-apiyân otaskihk ôma kâ-otinamân âcimôwin
sentences.english: In his land I heard this story of him; even here where I sit, in this his land I learned this story.

sentences.original: êkosi.
sentences.text: êkosi
sentences.english: That is all.
